title: The American Journal of Economics and Sociology
text:
The American Journal of Economics and Sociology is a <a href="peer-reviewed">peer-reviewed</a> <a href="academic%20journal">academic journal</a> established in 1941 by Will Lissner with support from the <a href="Robert%20Schalkenbach%20Foundation">Robert Schalkenbach Foundation</a>. The purpose of the journal was to create a forum for continuing discussion of the issues raised by <a href="Henry%20George">Henry George</a>, a <a href="political%20economy">political economist</a>, <a href="social%20philosophy">social philosopher</a>, and <a href="activism">political activist</a> of the late 19th century. The <a href="editor-in-chief">editor-in-chief</a> is Clifford W. Cobb.
Abstracting and indexing.
The journal is abstracted and indexed in:
According to the "<a href="Journal%20Citation%20Reports">Journal Citation Reports</a>", the journal has a 2018 <a href="impact%20factor">impact factor</a> of 0.455, ranking it 328th out of 363 in the category "Economics" and 134 out of 148 in the category "Sociology".
